New Records: Gunnar Henderson tied the Orioles' single-season shortstop home run record
Key Match Events: The Orioles' offense erupted in the sixth inning, scoring six runs and extending their lead to 11-2
Each Orioles starter recorded a hit and scored a run for the first time since Aug. 25, 2017
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brandon Hyde praised Gunnar Henderson's leadoff home run, saying it helped the team regain momentum
Starter Corbin Burnes expressed confidence in the team's offense, saying they showed their true form in the win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles maintained their pace at a half game behind the Yankees at the top of the AL East standings
The team's win streak extended to two games
Others: Gunnar Henderson's 34th home run was hit at 108.2 mph, the fastest recorded in his career
